name: Homemade Pizza
ingredients: 1 package (2 1/4 teaspoons) of active dry yeast
feta cheese, firm mozzarella cheese, grated
instructions: Prepare the pizza dough.
Spread pizza sauce over the dough.
Add fresh mozzarella cheese and your favorite toppings.
Bake in a preheated oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.

name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente.
In a bowl, whisk eggs and cheese together.
In a skillet, cook pancetta until crispy.
Toss cooked spaghetti with pancetta and egg mixture.

name: Caprese Salad
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella cheese.
Arrange them on a plate, alternating slices.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle with olive oil and balsamic glaze. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Pasta Primavera
ingredients: 2 cups (240g) mixed vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, broccoli, carrots)
instructions: Cook penne pasta according to package instructions.
In a skillet, sauté minced garlic and mixed vegetables until tender.
Stir in heavy cream and cook until heated through.
Toss cooked pasta with the vegetable and cream mixture. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve garnished with grated Parmesan cheese and fresh parsley.

name: Tiramisu
instructions: In a bowl, whisk egg yolks and sugar until pale and creamy.
Fold in mascarpone cheese until well combined.
Quickly dip ladyfinger cookies into brewed coffee and arrange them in a serving dish.
Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture over the cookies.
Repeat layers and finish with a dusting of cocoa powder.
Refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

name: Risotto alla Milanese
instructions: In a saucepan, heat the broth and saffron over low heat.
In a separate large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Add Arborio rice and stir to coat with oil and butter.
Pour in white wine and cook until mostly absorbed.
Begin adding the saffron-infused broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed before adding more.
Continue until the rice is creamy and cooked al dente. Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with grated Parmesan cheese.

name: Minestrone Soup
ingredients: 1 cup (120g) small pasta (e.g., ditalini or macaroni)
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion, garlic, carrots, celery, and zucchini. Sauté until softened.
Stir in crushed tomatoes and cooked cannellini beans.
Pour in vegetable broth and bring to a boil.
Add small pasta and cook until al dente.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve with fresh basil leaves and grated Parmesan cheese.

name: Chicken Piccata
instructions: Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
Dredge them in flour, shaking off excess.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium-high heat.
Add chicken breasts and cook until golden brown and cooked through.
Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same skillet, add chicken broth, lemon juice, and capers. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced.
Return chicken to the skillet and simmer briefly in the sauce.
Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

name: Bruschetta
ingredients: Baguette or Italian bread, sliced and toasted
instructions: In a bowl, combine diced tomatoes, minced garlic, and chopped basil leaves.
Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Spoon the tomato mixture onto toasted slices of baguette or Italian bread.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and serve as an appetizer.
